alert.note: Alert for Boone; De Kalb; Grundy; Kane; Kendall; La Salle; Lee; Livingston; McHenry; Ogle; Winnebago (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Chicago (Northeastern Illinois and Northwestern Indiana)
info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued December 20 at 10:32AM CST until December 24 at 6:00AM CST by NWS Chicago
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH NOW IN EFFECT FROM THURSDAY MORNING THROUGH LATE FRIDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Blizzard conditions and dangerous travel possible. Winds could gust as high as 55 mph. * WHERE...Portions of central, north central, and northeast Illinois. * WHEN...From Thursday morning through late Friday night. * IMPACTS...Falling and blowing snow may result in white out conditions with zero visibility at times, making travel extremely difficult, if not impossible. Power outages will also be possible as a result of strong damaging wind gusts to 55 mph. Roads may become ice covered as temperatures rapidly fall on Thursday. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Bitterly cold wind chills as low as 25 to 30 below zero are likely Thursday night and Friday. Wind chills of this magnitude can cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 20 minutes.
info.instruction: Prepare for dangerous travel and possible blizzard conditions. Continue to monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.

area.areaDesc: Boone; De Kalb; Grundy; Kane; Kendall; La Salle; Lee; Livingston; McHenry; Ogle; Winnebago
